Review.Contenu: 1) I expected better quality.  A very tinny noise at elevated levels.2) If I would have known these were made in China, I would not have purchased.  I thought Aperion was made in the USA.

I just bought a pair of aperion super tweeter and very disappointed it didn’t sound good as I expected. It was very weak hardly hear it. Even if you put your ears directly to it. I even run it direct to the amp by itself and still sound like whispering.It’s a waste of money and I wouldn’t recommend it.

Paid over $1000 for a subwoofer.  Luck for me the first time it died it was just inside the warranty.  Second time not so lucky.  They tell me they did not even manufacture this sub.  It has another companies components inside.  I feel like I got taken.  And I have a $1000 paperweight.Last time I buy from them.BTW I have 2 of their tower speakers and 2 center speakers as well.  No issues.

Review.Titre: One of the worst companies I've ever…
Review.Contenu: One of the worst companies I've ever dealt with. Sold speakers with a 10 year warranty attached to a wireless head unit with a 1 year warranty that never worked correctly. They knew it. Never tried to work with me to make this right. I gave the useless speakers away and bought new ones from a reputable company.I can't believe these idiots contacted me for a review, they've only reminded me that I should have sued them.

Review.Titre: I will never forget the horrible…
Review.Contenu: I will never forget the horrible condition my new speakers arrived in.  I sent Aperion photos of the Fed-Ex delivery guy and his disheveled truck and the boxes that would not even stand up strait.  Aperion said: "Oh the speakers are fine inside the box."  OK, how about I pick up your speakers and throw them?  Horrible customer service.  Surprised they are still in business.  Actually, they may not be...I heard they were bought out.

Years ago I bought the Aperion Intimus 5t Wireless system and paid top dollar for it expecting to get a premium product. Well, as component entertainment systems usually last years this has not and several speakers as well as the receiver have failed on me. While Aperion was once happy to help the product and support have long since been discontinued and now I am left with a half operating, expensive $3,000+ piece of junk. I should have known and will likely never purchase an Aperion Audio product again.

Buyer be ware. The good is great sound at a reasonable price. The bad is terrible service. My sub-woofer power amp blew out soon after purchase, When I called for help I was told too bad. They can not fix it, provide replacement parts or suggest where to get it fixed. Basically I have $1000 paper weight.

DO NOT BUY! My purchase of an Aperion Summit 5.1 wireless speaker system is one of the worst decisions I have ever made.  They system started failing within several months of purchase, but by that time, the agreement between Aperion and Summit (owner of the wireless technology) had fallen apart.  No warranty, parts or other support available. For what it’s worth, the people at Aperion are polite, and tried to help me troubleshoot the multiple problems, but unapologetic and offered no compensation or other advice. A $3000 mistake.

I have had good experiences with their passive speakers but very bad experience with their active electronics.  My Bravus subwoofer has failed and a pair of Allaire speakers stopped working.  The big problem with that was that they had changed the design of the Allaire (after barely one year) and no longer offered replacement parts.  They didn't stand behind their product and they didn't offer me any kind of favorable replacement option.To make matters worse I tried to leave an honest review of the Allaire on their website and they never allowed it to be published.

Review.Titre: I bought a set of Intimus Tower…
Review.Contenu: I bought a set of Intimus Tower speakers and Verus II Grand Center (which is excellent).   The towers get shrill (totally lacking in base) and pushed to higher volumes.  When bi-amped - it gets WORSE.   The biggest problem I had with Towers was a mfc defect in the front base support (yes ... a simple cast aluminum part - that would not hold a screw leg ,,, so the speaker would like fall over).   I tried more than a half dozen times talking to customer service ... they have sent me (over time) 3 different replacement front leg brackets ... not a single one was compatible (different height) with the rear bracket.   I give up.

Review.Titre: I thought these speakers were just…
Review.Contenu: I thought these speakers were just flat.  Turns out the tweeters were non-working.  Aperion doesn't even carry the model to fit their boxes (early generation diaural x-over).  Sub is good, though

Review.Titre: When my Asperion subwoofer blew they…
Review.Contenu: When my Asperion subwoofer blew they offered no help in fixing it, told me to take it to an audio repair place to have it fixed. My Velodyne still blasting away and giving the best of performance.
Bought a subwoofer from Aperion. Failed after 5 years. Aperion refused to honor warranty and said that they no longer had the parts to fix it. Completely unsatisfactory response. Buyer beware.
Subwoofer blew after moderate use. No repair or discount was offered. Just told to buy another one which I of course declined to do. Would not recommend
refund wasn't issued when the equipments were returnedclaiming it was damaged. equipments returned properly in original packaging

Review.Titre: Purchased an Aperion Audio 4T Summit Wireless -- bad news!
Review.Contenu: Purchased an Aperion Audio 4T Summit Wireless system for $3000.00 in February 2013. Sound was very good and system was easy to setup. Initial support was very good. By May of 2015 it was non functional. While speakers were warranted for 10 years, electronics were only warranted for a year. Electronic transmitter went bad. Aperion sold system to us knowing it was going to be discontinued but did not tell us that. When problems occurred they Indicated they would still assist with the electronics mfg. to address malfunctions. Electronics manufacturer discontinued supporting the product. We were offered a paltry $750.00 by Aperion toward a new system, but we would have to return the old system at our own cost. Initially, Aperion's support was very helpful, but once the system was discontinued, the offer for replacement was inadequate as far as we were concerned, especially considering the system must have been known to be unreliable. Aperion took advantage of us as far as we were concerned. Now we have 5 large paper weights too big for a desk! Would not purchase from Aperion again.
Great customer service,  prompt and courteous.  Also very helpful with  acoustical set up!  I love My  speakers.

Review.Contenu: Asked to give me a positive review by (unwanted) email.

Review.Contenu: This company must be help to make more money and also give them attention seek of the help the unemployed people to Gain something on the internet to cater for them self

Aperion has quality and price (value) issues.  In my 5.1 system, I had both an in-ceiling rear speaker and the Bravus-8 subwoofer fail after a few years of service.  They could not support repair of the sub and I reluctantly ordered a new one.  Apparently, their new design couldn't make it out of the factory and after many months I cancelled the order.  Aperion sales wanted to sell me the 10" sub for $600, but I bought a Klipsch 10" sub for under $200 and it sounds great w/ the Intimus speaker set.

Review.Titre: Old technology that has lots of…
Review.Contenu: Old technology that has lots of problems: e.g. puts itself on stand by out of the blue, has to be reset lost of time. I don't recommend it. It lasted only 5 years and then all has become legacy: the UI, the connection standards and the sound standards; SW have never come in after 5 years

Review.Titre: I bought wireless speakers which are…
Review.Contenu: I bought wireless speakers which are fantastic and I love in 2012. I have wanted to buy more but was told they were out of stock. Now I believe they no longer make them. What a shame as they were a great product.

I purchased an expensive system from Aperion in 2011, the Intimus 4T Summit Wireless System. It worked well until 2015 when it began to fail. I called Aperion for help in repairing the system and was told that they no longer sell or support the system. There was nothing they could do to help with repair or replacement.I did receive advice from the tech support person suggesting that it might be a power issue. He advised me to search for a replacement power cable. I took his advice and fixed the immediate problem but I'm now on notice that when something more serious fails I'll have to replace the entire system, 6 speakers and the amplifier. I don't think I'll be purchasing a replacement from Aperion.

The fit and finish of the speakers are pleasing, but performance wise I expected more. The treble generated due to the size of the ribbon is negligible in my opinion. In addition, I also found that any adjustments made with the dial or jumpers had zero effect. Take into consideration, that I savor my highs to be extremely bright. Truth be known, I am a self professed treble guy. If you are like me, with the heightened expectation that these little boxes will cut through, or shatter glass with high frequency you will be dissatisfied. If you taste is tailored towards a very light audiophile accent to compliment your system, than these maybe for you.The market is far from being saturated with a choice of super tweeters, so  in all fairness this was a relatively low cost experiment.James

Review.Titre: I purchased a pair of the Intimus 5T…return policy less than desirable
Review.Contenu: I purchased a pair of the Intimus 5T tower speakers.  I wanted to match the current center channel finish Verus forte (piano black). I did not see this finish available in the piano black as part of their regular online product offering, but found the "piano black" offering as an open box.   I received the product and it had good sound presence, especially in the mid-range.  However, the speakers lack the bass output and the overall sound experience I was looking for.   I then call customer service to ask for a return (RMA) since i had only had the speaker approximately three weeks, but was told that since they were open box, I would have to pay to return them.  Highly disappointed in this return policy.  I guess I will have use Amazon going forward.  Amazon stands behind their return policy whether regular or discounted pricing applies to the merchandise. (Order #1518)

Review.Titre: The subwoofer is not working properly
Review.Contenu: The subwoofer is not working properly! No matter how to set it up. The mounting bracket behind the small speakers are not setup to hold the weight.

Speakers sound great. I rated 3 stars because of a huge gouge taken out of the side of one of the speakers. This was clearly something that occurred prior to packaging since none of the packaging was damaged. A good joke to send white gloves and a cleaning cloth in the box.

Review.Titre: Good Customer Service doesn't make up for a poor initial design.
Review.Contenu: I did not realize when I bought my book shelf speakers that there is no on off button on the speakers themselves, meaning if you loose or break your remote (which is what happened in my case after an 18" fall) the entire system becomes worthless.  Fortunately you can purchase replacement remote controls.  I bought two for the inevitable future falls from the coffee table.  Customer service was great and accommodating, but the original design and the light duty nature of the remote is horrible.  Wish I didn't have to spend money to fix this design flaw.

Review.Titre: Order was placed on 9-21 and my card…
Review.Contenu: Order was placed on 9-21 and my card was charged for the speakers that di not ship to me until 10-25.  The late shipping did not bother me because I knew the issues with shipping.  I do object to paying for something I do not have.  Should not have been charged for the speakers until they shipped.

Review.Titre: Great sounding speakers, but didn't last
Review.Contenu: Great sounding speakers (Zona wireless) that died after only 4.5 years -- they just stopped working. To their credit, Aperion's customer service/tech people tried everything they could think of to figure out a solution, including sending new power cords etc, but to no avail. Disappointing...

I rate Aperion 5 stars. great Service, packaged exceptionally nicely, high quality - in a class with speakers costing easillt twice as much, beautifl cabinets and audiophile sound way above its' selling price. I hove bought their best 7.2 systems for my home in texas and my home in Idaho.

I loved the quality of the speakers (Versus Grands), but felt that they were a little weak in the bass region, even for 2 channel music listening. I called customer service and their reply was to "get a subwoofer" to which I replied "That is why I purchased these large towers in the first place - not to have a subwoofer". They were not very cooperative when I wanted to return them either, as I did not have the boxes (they had gotten wet), even though I offered to pay for new boxes to ship them back in. I wound up selling them on e-bay, and loosing a good bit of money. So, not a great experience.

Meh... to much BS with their sub-woofers:Amp crapped out multiple times and then upgraded to the 12d and had more issues. Ended up with the piano black finish since they no longer offered the cherry which I never wanted.
I like the products and have the original version from 20 years ago. My only complaint is the customer service back then was to replace if anything was wrong with a product now I can’t get assistance

First off, the sound of these speakers are fantastic, as is the bluetooth connectivity. What really puts a damper in these speakers however is the fact that they automatically turn off after a few minutes. Having used these speakers for years now I will say that the experience has really been frustrating. Imagine going to the bathroom or going to get the mail then coming back to play something to then notice the speakers are off, then having to find the remote to turn them on because thats the only way they will turn on. Now imagine doing that everyday for 3 years. Its gotten to the point where I just leave something playing while I go make a lunch or some other random task so I don’t have to keep turning on the speakers when I return. All in all, great sound and features but the fact that it always turns off after a few minutes if I’m not playing some sort of sound makes this a hair-pulling product to own. I wouldn’t buy these again.

Order experience was highly problematic.  Called before ordering to confirm availability, then ordered a pair of high end speakers plus an integrated amp from another supplier.  Did not receive an order confirmation, nor did I receive the speakers.  When I called, it took a while to sort things out...only to be told my order did not get in on time to reserve the available speakers, and it may take months for me to get them.I already had the amp, and paid for it.Someone finally prioritized my order, and they sent me a pair of speakers that had been returned within a few weeks.  The color of the speakers (Cherry) did not match the photos on the website (they were stained a bright red, not natural Cherry colored as in the photos) so we returned them.The sound was o.k., but not natural enough to warrant the jarring aesthetics of the red speakers.  In all fairness, we expected the sound to be lifelike and on par with some fairly high end speakers we tried that were four times the cost.

Review.Titre: Missing one of the rubberized feet for…
Review.Contenu: Missing one of the rubberized feet for speaker.That g ok t you Mark's off.Otherwise .......
pricing could be better, the quality against some others may lack for the surround sound, theater

I bought a complete set of speakers from Aperion for a home theatre system I was installing in my home. I bought 2 large front facing speakers for either side of the screen, 4 smaller units to be mounted on the walls at the sides and back of the room, a separate speaker for under the screen and a large amplified speaker for bass sounds.My interaction with the company was very good throughout and I had no problems making my order or getting the speakers. They were shipped very well packaged/protected and were handsome to look at.My issue is that they just didn't sound as good as I was led to believe they would by advertising. I bought these over the internet based on others subjective reviews, but have to admit to being disappointed in this expensive purchase. By the time I was finished adjusting and working with them it was too late to do anything about it.The speakers play well at higher volume but are noticeably anemic when played more softly or at regular levels. The large powered woofer buzzes if left plugged in with the system off and also seems not to be very capable of adding any depth to sound when not played at higher volume. I had to return the first woofer I got for other issues...and this one developed it's own sometime after the warranty expired.I really wanted to like this company and their products...I think they handled all aspects of the sale and delivery quite well...and yet the product itself is as I mentioned before a disappointment.

Fantastic cabinet work… beautifully made. Sound is big and bold, yet able to communicate musical delicacies. Stage width better than depth, but both may improve after break in and placement changes. Grills are however a poor design- on bass heavy passages, grills rattle and the 8” drivers extend far enough to contact the plastic on the back side of the grills. Larger cutouts for the woofers are necessary to make the grills usable for dynamic passages.

Review.Titre: The appearance of these speakers are…
Review.Contenu: The appearance of these speakers are beautiful. Compared to several other speakers that I have, these take a lot of time to integrate into my systems. Treble is manageable, bass needs lots of attention, thumpy but not smooth. Overall I can make them sound good, but it takes several adjustments to be satisfied with the sound. Smooth out that bass and these speakers are grand slammers.

If you want premium speakers, you're gonna pay premium price. The finish on the Versus is so nice. Their website isn't too bad, definitely wish there were more information about setting the crossover levels.

Review.Titre: Very good performance for little money
Review.Contenu: I chose the basic planar ribbons as super-tweeters for my small system (incl. Odyssey monitors, GamuT amp, MSB DAC) which is room-EQed using Dirac Live DSP and ASI resonators, but the highs were lacking air and presence. The Aperion tweeters are more than easy to integrate, but I needed to choose a higher x-over point to avoid a degradation in uniformity, so 12k/14k was absolutely necessary for my system. Like all good super-tweeters  the ENTIRE frequency range is affected, as we listen to musical overtones and not to HF sine waves. So speaker integration was my priority here, and the outcome was quite good. Matching the goals I had beforehand. I have some IsoAcoustics pucks underneath them. The price is very modest. Very satisfied. As Aperion mentions explicitly, you will need to adjust X-Over freq. (HPF) + attenuation carefully, otherwise you won't be able match them to your speakers well.

I had heard of supper tweeters and it was logical to me, same as subwoofers are very popular today. But the ones i had found where all expencive, till i found what Aperion had to offer. Was very happy to find an option to my curiosity and i am enjoying trying them out and Aperion was very accesible to discus how to use them in the best way possible.

After waiting 14 years to finally get my speakers it was a bit disappointing to find they were damaged in shipping or packing. I can only hope the integrity of the speakers themselves were not harmed at all.

Review.Titre: Initial response was slow but after…
Review.Contenu: Initial response was slow but after reply communication and help was great. Part was under warranty and just had to pay shipping.

Wonderful product that provides a myriad of benefits, not just expanding the high end but also adding articulation to the bass, and widening/deepening the overall soundstage. Ultimately my main speakers (electrostatics) are just too inefficient to make these work full time, but I heartily recommend them to all that have 87+ sensitivity mains.Also please note that the company's communications and customer service are outstanding.Well done, Aperion!

Review.Titre: With the exception of a couple of…
Review.Contenu: With the exception of a couple of glitches in the connectors, which Aperion immediately rectified (after having to return it twice) due to inadequate solder joint; Aperion sent a new cable but it was longer than my original order necessitating a second return trip back to Aperion (I originally ordered a 3-ft.length) HOWEVER, this is the only reason why I gave it 4/5-stars. Customer service is superb, really aiming to please the client. And the sound of the Silver cables coupled with my Focal Elegia's/Astell and Kearns player is very difficult to tear myself away from because of their musicality, incredible detail and stage-like imaging.

Review.Titre: I like the rear speaker mounts I got
Review.Contenu: I like the rear speaker mounts I got - however, the screws were too short to bite through 5/8" sheetrock and into the studs behind. Had to substitute my own. Seems they should be an inch longer.
Bracket works well.  It was missing the silicone pads that keep the speaker bottom from resting directly on the wall.  I have reached out to Aperion to have them send me the parts.

Initially, had difficulty with a short in the right H.P. plug. Sent it back to Aperion and, after a second glitch, returned it again. But customer service was excellent. Very pleased with Aperion and the cables are superb!

Everything seems good on performance, even when my speakers are 98db sensitivity has being doing a good listening experience, BUT I received a pair of the gloss black and I purchase the Brush black as with the intention of get a speaker and system matching… it the only thing that’s is not ok .
Great products, customer service.

I just purchased a pair of Aperion Allaire Bluetooth speakers. My only complaint was the lack of a detailed step by step (with pictures for the challenged) description of the setup process. The speakers and remote were working fine, but I didnt know how to tell, so I ended up searching on the web for how to open the remote and replace the battery and so forth. I eventually requested assistance in a chat window on the web and someone got back to me by phone and they straightened me out right away. No harm done

Review.Titre: Nice to find a part for my 15 year old…
Review.Contenu: Nice to find a part for my 15 year old speakers. Communication with Aperion was long and drawn out but everything worked out in the end. Thanks Aperion for the part. Wish you had more offerings. Some folks hang on to good speakers and other high end audio equipment for years.

Review.Titre: Really good product for the money…
Review.Contenu: Really good product for the money Aperion can't be beat.  The only fallback is that some of their more popular speakers run out of stock, and there is a long waiting period for restocking to appear.  That's why I give them 4 stars and not 5.

Review.Titre: I give the aperion allaire speakers an A-
Review.Contenu: The company was easy to transact with. I was able to do a chat with a rep who provided me with a new customer discount code which was very much appreciated.  Speakers have excellent sound quality in the midrange to high end. Super clear and full at those frequencies.  I love the fact they accommodate Bluetooth and direct connection. The remote is handy as well. The only negative is that bass response is limited. Given the speaker size this is expected. I paired them with my Martin Logan sub and together they make beautiful music! Would recommend folks look at the bundle offered by aperion with subwoofer or just buy a decent 8” sub to go with it.

Review.Titre: Our dealings have been first class
Review.Contenu: Our dealings have been first class. We just wish that there was a coalition to provide some American Made and/or western world products. We don't like buying products made in countries controlled by dictators, i.e. China, Vietnam, etc.

All good, if I were to comment, the speaker stand for the super tweeters are exhorbitantly priced for what you get. Second signature delivery via USPS is a pain as no options are available for delivery ( unlike UPS and Fed Ex)

Great natural sound.  Bluetooth connects easily. Tried the optical connection, haven’t succeeded yet, still futzing with it. Aperion was great - I had mis-ordered, they sent my desired speakers the next day, got them the following day.

Review.Titre: Aperion Audio is great sounding bliss
Review.Contenu: Aperion Audio offers great sounding speakers at their price point with amazing finishes. The equipment looks like it costs hundreds, if not thousands, more. Clarity, detail and bass response is good and customer service is great!

Good speakers .I do have trouble with one of my Verus Grand Bookshelf speakers where the high frequency drops every once and a while.(I think it is a bad solder joint.)The speakers look great and sound good.

Review.Titre: The only reason that it wasn't 5 stars…
Review.Contenu: The only reason that it wasn't 5 stars was because one of my speakers had a random issue out of the box.But to their credit, a part was shipped ( out of country ) immediately and problem was solved.

Review.Titre: Like the tech support and speaker…
Review.Contenu: Like the tech support and speaker design.  However,  I did have some issues with the model I received,  but Aperion did not have another available pair to exchange.  But I will buy again..

Review.Titre: Aluminium Ribbon Super Tweeter: GREAT item, packaging mediocre only
Review.Contenu: Bought one piece of "Aluminum Ribbon Super Tweeter Speaker Pair Gloss Black" which is a great item to upgrade speakers lacking treble sparkle, resolution and extension (e. g. these with below top-notch grade soft dome tweeters). Highly recommendable! Do a great job on top of my Polk LSiMs.Item was shipped within 24 hours after purchase.My only complaint is poor packaging. Retail box is so damn tiny that speaker front has only 0.57" air clearance to cardbord from packaging. On rear side where binding posts stick out it's only 0.35" clearance to cardboard.It was bound to happen mine were hit centrically at one speaker's leading edge by intrusion in transit, resulting in minor dent visible. As I am not a nitpicking guy it's still O.K. to me. But it could be avoided by using larger foamed inserts and just a little bigger retail box. These sit too close to cardbord in their packaging, at least with their unprotected middle of cabinets.
Extremely pleased with the sound quality and purchasing / customer service representative.
Tower soeakers are good but not great, and wireless bookshelf speakers are problematic in that they need additional attention to turn on.

Review.Titre: Over a decade ago I bought an S10…
Review.Contenu: Over a decade ago I bought an S10 powered sub.  It has had very little use and no abuse.  It went unused for about the past five years and properly stored.  When I went to use it recently it had no output.  I carefully reviewed the owner's manual to no avail.  I called Aperion on two occasions and spoke to two different employees there, Steve being one.  They were very patient, responsive, and helpful.  The problem couldn't be solved over the phone.  I ended up taking the speaker to them where they ran tests and determined the amp was not working.  They could not repair it due to parts unavailability.  In the big picture I was disappointed that the sub failed with so little use and good care.  I was also disappointed that they could not repair their own product.  I can't say I'm happy with the product, but I am very pleased with their customer service and attitude.  I would purchase another product from them.  I found a terrific old school stereo repair shop near Aperion and I believe they can repair my unit.
11 Years after purchase, now you want a rating?  Speakers are ok.  Mounts have broken and had to be repaired.
Nice looking High Quality Build. Over priced. Limited at high volume listening...not built for the Disco
I have had the speakers and sub for 8 years and everything works. Good value for the money. No issues
Does not have the range I need, but, it did solve a lot of distribution situations in-house.

Review.Titre: No problem with any service or…
Review.Contenu: No problem with any service or products.  Only suggestion would be little more bass.
Customer support was helpful. The speaker was sounding good, but not my taste
Great equipment, delivered on time and in good condition.  Love it.

Review.Titre: I love the sound I’m just not that into…
Review.Contenu: I love the sound I’m just not that into the look of the speaker.

Review.Titre: High quality sound at reasonable price
Review.Contenu: High quality sound at reasonable price. Very attractive too
Very helpful of the sales representative, well done!

Review.Titre: Need bigger speakers to compete against…
Review.Contenu: Need bigger speakers to compete against Klipsch Audio.
Great service. Very responsive and helpful.

Review.Titre: I was looking for a 3 way center…
Review.Contenu: I was looking for a 3 way center speaker and after doing way to much research I ran across a couple of you tube reviews. The reviews were very positive so I decided to give them a try and I can say the sound and built quality are superb! Having a 3 way center is a must. I also bought the Novus bookshelf speakers to go with the new center in a small home theater, they are awesome as well. Looking to move the bookshelves to the back and add some Novus towers in the front. The only disappointment is how hard these where to find while doing my research for new speakers.

Aperion's customer service has been excellent!  The guys were all extremely helpful over the phone and even more so in person.  I had an issue with a mysterious popping sound in my subwoofer.  Because I'm in the Portland area, I was able to stop in, and they swapped out the amp for it!  It was quick and seems to have resolved the issue.  Thanks so much!

This is my first separate amp for my theater.  The Sales/Support folks were informative and very helpful answering questions. The difference the amp made over my AVR is amazing. By pulling the load off the AVR, even the other speakers improved when playing Atmos related content.

Love the AMT super tweeter, great product and extremely well built. Love the fact it has gain and frequency adjust can be easily integrated with any speakers where as most super tweeters have just one adjust and becomes very challenging and compromising. Built very solid, extremely robust. Custom service was fantastic, responsive and very helpful. Very happy with the product and very happy with their service, absolutely recommended! I would be recommending this to my friends. 5 stars all the way.

Aperion Audio has very knowledgeable and helpful staff who are very focused on customer service. I bought 2 Verus V8Ts, a Verus V8C, and 4 Clearus C8Cs for the ceiling Atmos speakers. The speakers are amazing and I am very happy.
Sounds great! Doesn’t take too much space. Snuck it in when wife was not looking.

Review.Titre: Continues to have great service and the…
Review.Contenu: Continues to have great service and the absolute best speakers. I’m a repeat customer.

Review.Titre: New Tri polars speakers from Aperion Audio
Review.Contenu: Great service with great product and rapid fed ex delivery. I installed the new Tripolar speakers and luv the way they enhance my home theater experience!

Review.Titre: As always the customer service with…
Review.Contenu: As always the customer service with Aperion Audio is outstanding! Colin was knowledgeable and allowed me to test drive my new subwoofer in the showroom. My old Klipsh sub died, so now I have the matching Bravus subwoofer to go with my Bravus bookshelves and center channel and surrounds, This 10” sub is amazing for its size, plenty deep, punchy and accurate. Thanks again Colin for guiding me to another satisfied sale!!
The speaker is performing well but I was very pleasantly surprised at packaging of the speaker. A lot of work went into insuring that the speaker was not damaged in delivery!

I got great advice from customer support before ordering which helped me choose the correct model. Shipping was fast and the product arrived in perfect condition. I ordered the Planar magnetic supertweeter to pair up with Magnepan main speakers. The synergy is great and I am enjoying the extra level of space and detail the super tweeters have added. I was expecting a lot more subtle effect but this has far exceeded my expectation

After much searching and review I chose the Verus V8T stereo speakers to upgrade my 1999 rack mount system. My system is anchored with a 1999 Parasound HCA-1500A power amp rated 205 watts x 2 at 8 ohms and 315 watts x 2 at 4 ohms which easily drives the superb V8T's to wounderful sound despite the amps age. Besides the highly satisfactory performance, the V8T includes supreme build quality and features. I am very happy with the V8T's and rate them a 5 star product!

First let me say the packaging is excellent and well above average compared to mainstream brands at these price levels.  The attention to safe packaging cannot be overstated - I've received $3,000 speakers where the packaging is blown to bits and unusable a second time - not the case with Aperion Audio Novus I received.Fit-N-Finish: Top marks for visual finish, design and build quality.  The N6T's are even more handsome in person.  I love the unique reflex slotted port as well as the subtle baffle slope. Bass driver quality is good, crossover parts are above average in this category.  You will not find ceramic resistors in oversees designs at this price level.  The grills are impressive as are the many fine details of a $1700 speaker. Sound: I give the N6T top marks as a dynamic, punchy and well sorted micro detail speaker for movies.  For music, the Novus are cut from the typical American sound profile, lots of hard rocking bass, extra leading edge detail for your brass and symbols, yet a little too light in the vocal department.  Think Hans Zimmer Film Scores - the Novus are up to the task with full range movie scape sound.  You will want a very strong tube amp or high quality class A/B amp that promotes midrange warmth to extract the very best from your N6T's.  *Use thick copper speaker cables, avoid silver cables, the N6T need no assistance with upper treble energy.  Aperion Audio speakers should last you many trouble free years.

Not all recordings are made equal of course, but every recording that I’ve listened to sounds great, and the best are almost unbelievable in their clarity. While they certainly are not cheap. I can honestly say that for this price point I can’t imagine any speaker being better. I am running them through an Onkyo RZ – 950 receiver, which I am now just using as a pre/pro. As I also purchased the new E5 amplifier, and am powering the four height modules (Atmos) with the Emotiva Basx four channel amplifier. Again, absolutely stunning. I can’t imagine wanting a different speaker in this price range. Aperion my hat is off to you! And thank you for the gift of me falling in love with music once again!!
